API Documentation

This section contains the complete API reference for our product. The API allows you to interact with our service programmatically.

Overview

Our API is organized around REST principles. It accepts JSON-encoded request bodies, returns JSON-encoded responses, and uses standard HTTP response codes.

Authentication

All API requests require authentication. You can authenticate by including your API key in the Authorization header:


Authorization: Bearer your-api-key

Endpoints

The API is available at https://api.example.com/v1. All requests should be made to this base URL followed by the specific endpoint path.

Available Endpoints

  • Users - User management endpoints
  • Products - Product management endpoints
  • Orders - Order management endpoints

Rate Limiting

The API enforces rate limiting to protect against abuse. The current limits are:

  • 100 requests per minute for free accounts
  • 1000 requests per minute for premium accounts

If you exceed these limits, you'll receive a 429 Too Many Requests response.

Response Format

All responses are returned in JSON format with the following structure:


{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    // Response data
  },
  "meta": {
    "timestamp": "2025-01-01T12:00:00Z",
    "request_id": "request-id-12345"
  }
}

For error responses, the format is:


{
  "success": false,
  "error": {
    "code": "error_code",
    "message": "Error message",
    "details": {
      // Additional error details
    }
  },
  "meta": {
    "timestamp": "2025-01-01T12:00:00Z",
    "request_id": "request-id-12345"
  }
}
